newsitem.title: BANGLADESH: Bangladesh taka eases on higher dollar demand.
newsitem.headline: Bangladesh taka eases on higher dollar demand.

text.p: Dollar demand rose slightly in interbank trading on Wednesday, forcing the Bangladesh taka to finish weaker at 42.5360/5440 to the U.S. currency against the previous close of 42.5325/5375, dealers said.
The local unit was quoted at 42.5375/5475 per dollar in early trade but edged up later in a dollar surplus market.
"Cheap call money resulted increased buying (of dollars), but there there were still enough dollars in the market," said one dealer.
Most deals were done at around 42.5400 level.
Interbank call money rates ended flat at 3.75 to 4.25 percent.
